definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: He planted his fists in the boy 's face.
sentences.chinese: 他用拳頭猛打這個小男孩的臉。

sentences.english: John was so angry that he jabbed her with his right hand.
sentences.chinese: 約翰非常生氣，結果他揮右拳猛打了她一下。

sentences.english: Taking up a stick, he caught the boy and laid on vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 他操起一根棍子，抓住那男孩猛打。

sentences.english: We are not opposed to hot pursuit in uninhabited areas.
sentences.chinese: 我們不反對在無人居住的地區窮追猛打。

definition: lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
lit. to shoot from both sides (idiom)/fig. to display ambidexterity/to slap with one hand and then the other, in quick succession/to use both feet equally (football)
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to run away/to flee in disarray
regardless of the consequences/recklessly relying on a hopelessly optimistic forecast
pinyin: bu4 guan3 san1 qi1 er4 shi2 yi1
